title: Fail / Retry?
comment: It's hard to fault a product so feature rich that is made available for free, and the ownCloud server is great in this respect.  The app, however, which IS a paid-for product is a disappointment.  When uploading a file over 3G it all too often fails part way through, then hangs forever at, say, 67%.  Or, it will know it has failed and when you click on the notification status it then just opens the ownCloud folder that your upload /would/ of gone to had it worked.  The annoyance is not simply having a "Retry" option to re-upload again without having to task kill the app and finding your file to upload.  Fix that and you're onto a winning app.  Two stars for the app, 10+ for the web back-end.

title: Useless until timeout error fixed!
comment: Tried installing on a Samsung Galaxy S5, tried both rooted and non-rooted. Works fine on an old T-Mobile SpringBoard (Huawei MediaPad) with Android ICS, but under the KitKat load on the Galaxy it keeps going 'Server took too long to respond' every time I try to connect.  I know this is a client issue because, as mentioned, the load on the SpringBoard works perfectly well. This also means the server side is OK with Apache as the web service end.  No, I'm NOT changing my entire web structure to Nginx just to accommodate what should not have to be accommodated! This is a client-side issue and needs to be fixed at that level.  Two stars only until this problem is dealt with.

title: so-so.
comment: Bought it because I like the idea, but I actually just need it for one very purpose (sharing one or two files directly via "send to" -> "owncloud" on the device for which I haven't found a replacement yet). Using FolderSync for more complex syncing these days as the owncloud client definitely is _very_ bare-bone. At first, simply naming this "owncloud" is a bit misleading - it should possibly be "owncloud file client" as it is limited to handling WebDAV/files and ignores anything else owncloud has to offer - calendar? vcards? Plus, even in transferring files, the app leaves things to be improved: Making the storage folder configurable would be a start - I definitely would like to have this on external_SD in my device. Same, a real folder sync would help - this is basically impossible at the moment (if I manually create folders or files in the owncloud folder on the Android device, the app still doesn't see or transfer these). Maybe future versions will do better here.

title: Needs a lot of work
comment: UPDATE: New build just thrashes the battery. Had to uninstall... I already sent an error log in.  Missing multi select, needs to be updated to SDK 16+, UI still has portions of Froyo/GB with the download/upload intent. Sync can be slow at times. It has a ways to go, but has potential. Just use foldersync for now.  Chokes on large uploads, server is configured to allow large uploads as well.  Things it needs:  1. Calendar sync adapter to Android Calendar 2. Contacts sync adapter to Android Contacts 3. Multi-select to modify files: move, delete, copy (You can only delete right now, but can not multi-select) 4. Need to add an option to only allow uploading while charging as well 5. Option upload videos as well 6. Thumbnails support for videos/pictures 7. Support for ownCloud docs 8. Better tablet support  These additions will get it to a 4 - 4.5, then some refinement on top of that.

title: Works, but is basic
comment: There is great potential for this app, but it lacks some standard features that one has come to expect from similar apps such as Dropbox. At this point I find that two missing features in particular stand out: (1) no thumbnail view of images and (2) no ability to send links to files. Other useful additions to the app would be the ability to select multiple files, an integrated way to sync contacts and calendar, and the ability to choose where the files will be stored (external SD card rather than phone memory would be nice). I consider my purchase a donation to a good cause and hope to see improvements through user support.

title: Works but quite basic sync client
comment: Installation and connecting to my own owncloud was quick and painless.  However the client is severely lacking in some basic features: 1) No way (?) to sync the entire contents of your owncloud - have to sync each file/folder individually.  This may be a good thing as it allows you to only sync the items you actually want on your phone, however it would be equally good to be able to say "sync all" and then unselect certain items. 2) No way to specify the location on your phone. This is a BIG problem for people whose main memory is more or less full but have an SD card available. 3) No way to specify the auto-upload location of photos. 4) No way to share files/folders with other users  While owncloud itself is great I struggle to be able to recommend this client in its current state as a paid-for app. Once fully-featured, I'd be more than happy to recommend it.

title: Needs work
comment: First off: if you want calendar or contacts sync, search for CalDAV or CardDAV by Marten Gajda (he says he'll open source them Some Day).   It claims it can do instant photo uploads, but all it does is create an empty folder and then complain that the folder doesn't exist. You're still stuck with Ubuntu One for that task.  This app only works for file downloads/uploads and playing single songs (no playlist/album play/repeat/cover art). Since the ampache server stopped working with ownCloud 5, there are no other apps available to play your ownCloud music either, so you're stuck with keeping a Subsonic installation for that.  I'm giving it stars since I like the ownCloud _server_, it works great for calendar and contacts sync, but I'll be uninstalling this app until it gets useful.

title: It's a beginning...
comment: It's great to have the ability to access your owncloud files from tablet or phone, but in real life it's still way too alpha for everyday use.  I have a big tree of directories and files (for example, copied my complete dropbox in it), and even if I'm using a decent wifi connection, some files are synced, the others are not. There are folders (of which "Work" seems to be the most important one) which simply don't synchronize. I guess it is because the syncing process halts at some moment, but if you compare the speed with which Dropbox shows folder content and with which Owncloud shows folder content --> that's a huuuuuge difference.  In short, I think it's going well, but more frequent updates would definitely be nice as would a more complete GUI and smarter syncing be (give priority to a directory I'm viewing instead of syncing some other one I probably don't need for another week).

Too few options compared to webversion

title: Great but needs improvement
comment: The only feature needed is the ability to view files, especially photos without having to download them.

title: Can't stream.
comment: Not up to par with Dropbox but still pretty cool. I wish I could stream content

title: Well done!
comment: Great job so far! There's quite a lot of things to do but I know it takes time to get the full result. Keep up!

title: Why did you break it
comment: This was working and now it updated. Force closes always. Bad Form cloud crew Bad Form

title: Nice to sync my owncloud with tablet
comment: Great with the last owncloud 4.5 to sync data with my personal owncloud
Works nicely on my SG note.

title: Doesn't sync back to server
comment: Latest version doesn't loop or crash anymore, but never syncs local changes back to server. They get overwritten instead. So it's a download-only client right now.

title: Inconsistent.
comment: (0) The pictures that are newly uploaded are corrupted? My computer is not able to read the recently uploaded. (1) Fails very frequently to upload pictures. No chance to retry? How do I see the list of failed upload other than the notification bar? Clicking on fail notification should lead to the file that failed to give  a chance to retry, and to know the reason. How about a red X on the files that failed when browsing? (2) Nice additions: select all, video/picture thumbnail view, todo list sync. (3) For the OwnCloud server, Google Calendar/Contact sync, not just mounting GDrive.

title: Doesn't look good on a tablet
comment: Yes, it's low cost but maybe a trial period for evaluation would be better. Will come back and update my review once i've had chance to test. Struggles with multiple uploads.

title: Work to do
comment: Works fine but very basic compared to others eg drop box.

title: Works as expected
comment: File syncing is enough for me, other "app" clutter would likely be annoying.

title: Needs a little more work
comment: Works good but would be nice to be able to select multiple files and directories for syncing. Tried to upload several directorys w/ pix inside; After the upload, all directorys were stripped off and all the pix ended up in one directory on the server. Aside from that, its works pretty good from what I can see. Have just had it installed for two days now.

title: missing essential functionality
comment: Does not sync changes made to files on phone back to the server.

title: Excellent!
comment: The best ive found anywhere! You guys are the best! I recently got a new phone and once i installed this app everything from my old phone appeared on my new phone. Im a happy camper..

title: Can't even connect  !
comment: I use no-ip for the dyn dns, which works fine in any browser, here i just get "couldn't find host", hence can't get an account setup, hence this app is useless, hence it's a waste of money !

title: Awesome app
comment: A real nice app and a good alternative to Dropbox and Co.

title: multiple accounts not working
comment: Works fine as far as I can test, but no matter what or how I tried, only the first added account is active, and i can't switch between them.

title: Unfinished
comment: App has some basic features that work fine (filesync) and other totally missing, like calendar.  Work to do to get fifth star.

title: Feedback
comment: Predictable app, works fine

title: Connect button remains disabled
comment: I always tried to use the free app in the past but that one didn't work at all. So I was really excited and finally bought the "commercial" version. But disappointment followed quickly after my purchase: Already when trying to enter the URL and the credentials I got stuck as the "Connect" button remains disabled whatever I enter in the form fields. Pretty annoying I have to say

title: Not even beta quality
comment: I should have listened to the other reviews. This thing is not even beta quality and the slow pace of its development indicates it may never get there.   Odd error messages, random crashes and a serious lack of features cripple what could be a dropbox killer.

title: Loses account details
comment: Loses my account details every time the phone restarts.

title: Broken
comment: Can only download certain mime types, thinks epub files are folders and can't download them, other types of files aren't even listed in the folder view.

title: Works good
comment: Nice and simple.  I have no problem paying for this since Owncloud server was free.  Keep up the good work Owncloud developers.

title: Stalled?
comment: I guess I should have just kept the original one by Bartek Przybylski? This one keeps loosing my account info on JB 4.1.1 ... continued development would be nice though.

title: Andrew tch
comment: It lacks even logout button. Currently unusable but promising.

title: No automatic sync makes this app useless for me
comment: I'm really a fan of OwnCloud. I installed an instance on my linux server at home an sync several windows PCs. But without an automatic synchronization of files modified on my android device, this app is absolutely useless for me. I hope you guys will implement this feature ASAP. I will check GitHub. Perhaps I can do it on my own.

title: Missing core features for phone
comment: It should include contacts and calendar sync, its more important than synchronising files on mobile phone.

title: Waste of a dollar.
comment: I agree with earlier posts, it should not be out of alpha release: why should I pay for this? Downloading multiple files crashes app/phone, keeping files up-to-date crashes app/phone.  You can download single files and upload single files. This app has less functionality than the web GUI. Quit charging people for your broken trash.

title: App continuously loses account
comment: Any network failure to connect to an own cloud server and it forgets the account which stops instant upload as well. Not the best programming decision. I shouldn't have to continuously be reading my server info.

title: Working om
comment: After spending an age trying set this up on my server, failing, and then opting to pay  for a hosted install I'm actually very happy with this. Not quite sure how reliable at backup this is just yet but so far so good

title: Mediocre at best
comment: Can't believe I paid money for this. Biggest bug bear is that it loses account credentials on reboot, and I do that a lot considering I'm using cm10 roms. And it's been like this for a while. No acknowledgement or a fix. Use, and but only if you never reboot, then else it'll just get too painful.

title: Upload sync broken. Unusable
comment: Modifying a "keep sync" file causes infinite upload loop to the server. Unusable in my opinion. Maybe in the future
Getting better

title: A good start but insecure
comment: Accepts any certificate without complaint. Currently too insecure to use on public wifi. Thankfully openvpn works well, making it possible to securely run own cloud for now. Desperately needs certificate pinning!

title: Getting better all the time
comment: Not prefect but seems to be getting better all the time. Have disabled the instant picture upload because it didn't work very well but find the ability to access my files anywhere really good. Thanks and keep up the good work.

title: Okay, but has a way to go
comment: EDIT: The latest version seems to fix battery drain issues.  I won't knock this app too much since this is the very first release, but it goes without saying that there are a lot of changes that need to be made. Why am I unable to select multiple items? Why can't I download a folder? Why am I unable to press a button to get a share link in the file context menu? I could do that on the Tonido app, and I really miss it.  On the plus side, instant upload seems really nifty.

title: Rubbish
comment: Sync was intermittent at best,  and for the last 24 hours hasn't updated at all

title: Keep going!
comment: Nice idea, nice app. Please keep going! Would be good to have sync status or log info,like in desktop sync client.

title: Does not work
comment: Installed...setup... Would not sync... Desktop client does not work either. The web app works great tho.

title: Good App
comment: Works very well for file uploads and looks good.  It will be a great app once they get calendar sync working.

title: Still buggy
comment: Instant Upload sync photos sometimes, sometimes it don't. Video files did not sync at all. After one-two days usage "Upload failed: 0/1 files uploaded" error occures, recreating account solves it for one-two days. Using my own owncloud instance, Galaxy Nexus 4.1.1, desktop aplications syncs correctly.

title: Early days
comment: This has a lot of potential to be amazing, at the moment it's just a bit of fun but camera upload doesn't work on my HTC Desire S

title: Bug!
comment: Works great but the process eats all my battery in under 3 hours. (Nexus S)

title: Great idea but....
comment: I run my own ownCloud instance for some time and really like it but I am unable to use this app. It connects just fine via HTTPS but does not show any files. Please fix!

title: Useless
comment: Still can't log in if your device is in portrait orientation. Need a true music player on mobile and ability to easily download music to your devices. One song at a time is useless. Try creating a well functioning app before charging people.

title: Good start
comment: File sync works as advertised, although "automatic camera upload" doesn't on my HTC One X. Missing calendar sync is a let down. Contact sync would be nice to have.

title: at last!
comment: I can access and sync files with my owncloud server.  looks good, works for me!
